availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Erasmus D. Ricketts (Louisville, Kentucky, druggist, furniture dealer, and soldier, 1st district prov govt rep)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, druggist, furniture dealer, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of David C. Ricketts. Married to Missouri Froman Ricketts in Jefferson County on May 3, 1853. Father of Mary J. Ricketts. Married to Elizabeth Stivers Ricketts in Jefferson County on November 6, 1858. Father of William W. Ricketts. Druggist in Louisville in 1850. Furniture dealer in Louisville in 1860. Employed Mary Hake as a domestic in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Served in the 6th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (C.S.A) as second lieutenant and captain from May 10, 1862, to March 16, 1864.
